## Overview

`cdeMissing` implements a CDE-style approach for longitudinal mixed models with missing covariates.

## Basic usage (Gaussian / LMM)

```{r, eval=FALSE}
library(cdeMissing)

fit <- cde_fit(
  y ~ x1 + Treatment + Time + x2,
  data = dat_long,
  id = "id",
  time = "Time",
  missing = list(
    baseline = c("x1"),
    time_dependent = c("x2")
  ),
  family = gaussian()
)

summary(fit)
cde_fixef(fit)
```

## Binary outcome (GLMM)

```{r, eval=FALSE}
fit_bin <- cde_fit(
  y ~ x1 + Treatment + Time + x2,
  data = dat_long,
  id = "id",
  time = "Time",
  missing = list(
    baseline = c("x1"),
    time_dependent = c("x2")
  ),
  family = binomial(),
  engine = "lme4",
  control = list(nAGQ = 0)
)
summary(fit_bin)
```
